conclusion: Analyze the problem based on given information and images.
The metal rod is suspended horizontally by two identical springs.
When current I_1 passes through the rod, the springs do not stretch, implying magnetic force equals weight of the rod.
Mathematical expression: B I_1 L = mg.
Current direction is from b to a, magnitude is I_2 where I_2 > I_1.
Due to magnetic force, the rod will experience an upward force.
Magnetic force on the rod is B I_2 L, weight is mg, net force is B I_2 L - mg.
Net force will stretch the springs.
Elongation of springs determined by Hooke's Law: F = k Δx.
Net force equation: B I_2 L - mg = 2k Δx.
Substitute mg from balanced condition: mg = B I_1 L.
Substitute into elongation equation: B I_2 L - B I_1 L = 2k Δx.
Simplify to: B L (I_2 - I_1) = 2k Δx.
Solve for Δx: Δx = (B L (I_2 - I_1)) / (2k).
Final expression for elongation: Δx = (B L (I_2 - I_1)) / (2k).
